results.title: A Banking career
results.creator_credit: Harley H. Davidson, Frederick Daniel and Artransa Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the various functions of a bank; the daily routine of business, and the responsibility of various bank officers. The latter part of the film lists the various advantages of making banking a career, mentioning rates of pay, special bonuses, opportunities for advancement, medical and sick leave benefits, pensions on retirement and the social life among bank personnel.

results.title: One designer, two designer
results.creator_credit: Alexander Stitt, Phillip Adams and Industrial Design Council of Australia
results.brief_description: This animated short film comically explores the importance of good design and the pitfalls of impractical design. It discusses the function of designers and designs, emphasising the need for the consumer to be more critical and thoroughly check each product before purchasing and the value of looking past attractive advertising slogans.

results.title: George and Toula
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A portrait of a marriage within the Greek community. George is Greek-born and Toula second-generation Australian. Toula has had a tertiary education and works in social services. She experiences much greater ambivalence about the traditions in which she was raised than her husband. The film is designed to show how an ethnic community shapes the lives of its members.

results.title: Betty: a shop steward
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Betty, from a Scottish working-class background, is a shop steward who plays a strong role in improving conditions at the factory in which she works. Intended to look critically and personally at the stereotype of the “pommy troublemaker” unionist, the film also raises other questions about working women.

results.title: Country Outcasts
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
Country outcasts is a small pop band made up from a number of talented Aborigines who have spent their lives in a wholly urbanised environment. This film is the story of a tour that this band makes through the outback, and the thoughts and feelings that are aroused within these city dwellers when they meet their trivialised brothers in Central Australia.

results.title: Leisure
results.creator_credit: Bruce Petty, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A fast-paced, humorous film, animated by Bruce Petty. The film emphasises the use of leisure time as an important aspect of life in our society. Planning for recreation and leisure time should be undertaken both on a personal and a broad public level. (Awards: Winner of the 1976 American Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film)

results.title: Travellin' round
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Richard Mason, Tourism Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A girl and a boy in a Landrover, a motorcyclist and a continent. These are the most essential ingredients of a travel film with a difference, showing the beauties and splendours of Australia. Featuring Tom Burstall, Adam Plate, Ingrid Tantu, Lloyd Sutton, Susan Hannaford. Music and lyrics by Michael Carlos and Judy Henderson.

results.title: Your body during adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Health and Safety for You”.
Eighteen young people from thirteen to fifteen are shown to vary widely in size and shape, although all are changing from childhood to adulthood. The film mentions the general functions of the endocrine glands and the influence of the pituitary glands on growth changes, which may normally occur in any order. The structure and functioning of the male and female reproductive organs are outlined.

results.title: [The White continent]
results.brief_description: In late 1949, a joint expedition planned by the Governments of Britain, Norway and Sweden left for Queen Maude Land on the Antarctic continent - this was to be the first truly international expedition to the Antarctic. The film covers the first stage of the journey, from departure point in Europe to the establishment of the base camps and later withdrawal of the ship’s party, leaving the groups of scientists to their study of the unknown world of ice and snow. Photography by Tom Stobart.

results.title: Venezuela
results.brief_description: Although rich in oil, Venezuela is beset with staggering problems. Poverty is rife in its capital - Caracas - where thousands of Indians dwell in one-roomed ranchitos. At the opposite pole are the rich with virtually no middle class between the two. The region of Orinoco seems immune to improvement and overall continued development in Venezuela depends largely on increased efforts in the areas of education and economic reform.
